title: Reveal and Launch of Procreate Dreams
heading: Procreate Dreams: Crafting our Reveal and Launch Campaign
description: I designed the reveal and launch campaigns for Procreate Dreams, introducing an all-new animation tool from the makers of Procreate to a broader audience.

award.text: Winner of the 2024 Apple Design Award for Innovation

content.title: The Challenge
text: The animation software market for iPad was already saturated with established players. In September 2023, we sought to enter this space with something truly revolutionary, unveiling a product 5 years in the making at [Playgrounds in Motion](https://weareplaygrounds.nl/in-motion-festival/) in London. We needed to differentiate Dreams not just through its features, but through a compelling narrative that would resonate with both professional animators and newcomers to the medium, marking a historic milestone for accessible animation in the Apple ecosystem.
We wanted to come out with a "Bang!". Well, a teaser first, to build expectation and anticipation for something game-changing.

content.caption: Credit: hero section designed by me, motion graphic created by our design team

content.title: Anticipation
text: In a market filled with established animation apps, we faced a unique challenge: how to build massive anticipation while keeping our product completely under wraps. We needed to leverage Procreate's reputation for excellence while maintaining absolute secrecy about what we were building.

Our strategy was to create an air of mystery that would capitalize on our brand's existing goodwill. We carefully crafted a reveal campaign that would generate excitement through strategic silence, letting our community's imagination and trust in the Procreate name drive the conversation.

content.caption: A custom countdown animation to build anticipation and excitement

content.title: Pre-Reveal Campaign
text: We built anticipation through a mysterious countdown campaign that hinted at something big coming. The landing page featured subtle animations that teased Dreams' capabilities without giving away what it was. This created buzz in the creative community, with many speculating about what Procreate had in store.
The campaign culminated in a save-the-date announcement for our reveal event, driving thousands of signups and social media engagement before we even showed the product.

content.title: Live Reveal
text: The September 8th event at Playground London marked the culmination of our launch strategy. We designed an immersive experience that demonstrated Dreams' capabilities through commissioned artwork and live demonstrations, showcasing how the tool could serve both professional animators and those just beginning their animation journey.

Procreate Dreams hero image showing the app interface

content.title: No subscriptions
text: One of the biggest moments during the reveal was announcing Dreams' one-time purchase price of $19.99. The crowd responded in applause when we revealed there would be no subscriptions - staying true to Procreate's philosophy of allowing professionals to own their creative tools without paying a recurring fee. This stance resonated strongly with our community and reinforced our commitment to putting artists first.

content.caption: A moment of surprise when my render was shown in front of my millions.

content.title: After the reveal
text: Along with designing a new comprehensive [Help Center](https://help.procreate.com), our marketing site was updated to highlight Dreams' groundbreaking features: real-time rendering for instant animation feedback, a subscription-free model with one-time purchase, and the introduction of video and audio capabilities to the Procreate ecosystem.
We built a pre-order campaign and invited users to celebrate with us that the Procreate experience they know and love has entered the world of animation.

content.caption: Video and audio introduced to the Procreate ecosystem
A crucial selling point for traditional Adobe users

text: I designed our marketing place with a vision of simplicity. I focused on capturing specific moments in the app where simplicity shined. We curated artwork that not only demonstrated Procreate Dreams' capabilities, but also complemented each other, showcasing how the app could adapt to any style or industry.

Our goal was to resonate with both animation newcomers and seasoned professionals, with a bias towards the prosumer. After all is said and done, our belief is that animation should be accessible to everyone.

images.alt: Procreate Dreams image made for iPad

content.title: Results
text: The launch exceeded our expectations with over 150k first-time downloads and more than 80k pre-orders. Our website saw close to 20k visits during the reveal and 63k visits on launch day. This success culminated in receiving the Apple Design Award for Innovation in 2024, recognizing our efforts to make professional animation tools more accessible.
